activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul D. Staples

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 1:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Paul D. Staples appeared by phone.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm appeared by video for Paul D. Staples. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 24, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Activity: Indigency hearing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:00 PM Defendant Paul D. Staples in court in person.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds the Defendant indigent and appoints attorney Philip Brehm. Defendant to reimburse the County $30 per month.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Indigency hearing on May 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Activity:  Adjourned initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

02:32 PM Defendant Paul D. Staples in court by phone.  Intern Margaret Ginocchio by video supervised by Emmeline Lee by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant did not qualify for public defender.  Petition for appointment of attorney filed.  Matter to be set with Judge Wood.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 01:55 PM Defendant Paul D. Staples in court appearing by audio.  Noah M Tylenda   and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video  for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $1,000.00   with conditions, Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of drug paraphernalia, Maintain absolute sobriety. Must sign bond March 8, 2022 between noon and 1pm. Matter continued to allow defendant time to obtain an attorney. Adjourned initial appearance March 30, 2022 at 1pm.
Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of drug paraphernalia, Maintain absolute sobriety.
Initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
